cache_inode_link.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00087 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00088 #include "config.h"
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 #include "LRU_List.h"
00092 #include "log_functions.h"
00093 #include "HashData.h"
00094 #include "HashTable.h"
00095 #include "fsal.h"
00096 #include "cache_inode.h"
00097 
00098 #include <unistd.h>
00099 #include <sys/types.h>
00100 #include <sys/param.h>
00101 #include <time.h>
00102 #include <pthread.h>
00103 
00125 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_link( cache_entry_t        * pentry_src, 
00126                                        cache_entry_t        * pentry_dir_dest, 
00127                                        fsal_name_t          * plink_name,     
00128                                        fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00129                                        hash_table_t         * ht,
00130                                        cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00131                                        fsal_op_context_t    * pcontext, 
00132                                        cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00133 {
00134   fsal_status_t           fsal_status ;
00135   fsal_handle_t           handle_src ;
00136   fsal_handle_t           handle_dest ;
00137   fsal_attrib_list_t      link_attributes ;
00138   cache_inode_status_t    status ;
00139   cache_entry_t *         pentry = NULL ;
00140   cache_entry_t *         pentry_lookup = NULL ;
00141   fsal_attrib_list_t      lookup_attributes ;
00142   hash_buffer_t           key ;
00143   hash_buffer_t           value ;
00144   cache_inode_fsal_data_t fsdata ;
00145  
00146   fsal_size_t             save_size ;
00147   fsal_size_t             save_spaceused ;
00148   fsal_time_t             save_mtime ;
00149    
00150   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00151   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00152 
00153   /* stats */
00154   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00155   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00156 
00157   /* Is the destination a directory ? */
00158   if( pentry_dir_dest->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00159       pentry_dir_dest->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00160     {
00161       /* Bad type .... */
00162       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00163       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00164 
00165       return *pstatus ;
00166     }
00167   
00168   /* Check if an entry of the same name doesn't exist in the destination directory */
00169   if( ( pentry_lookup = cache_inode_lookup( pentry_dir_dest, 
00170                                             plink_name, 
00171                                             &lookup_attributes,
00172                                             ht, 
00173                                             pclient, 
00174                                             pcontext, 
00175                                             pstatus ) ) != NULL )
00176     {
00177       /* There exists such an entry... */
00178       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00179       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00180 
00181       return *pstatus ;
00182     }
00183 
00184   /* The pentry to be hardlinked can't be a DIR_BEGINNING or a DIR_CONTINUE */
00185   if( pentry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ||
00186       pentry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00187     {
00188       /* Bad type .... */
00189       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00190       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00191 
00192       return *pstatus ;
00193     }
00194          
00195   /* At this point, we know that the entry does not exist in destination directory, we know that the 
00196    * destination is actually a directory and that the source is no directory */
00197                                    
00198   /* Lock the source */
00199   P( pentry_src->lock ) ;
00200  
00201   /* Lock the target dir */
00202   P( pentry_dir_dest->lock ) ;
00203   
00204   /* Get the handles */
00205   switch( pentry_src->internal_md.type )
00206     {
00207     case REGULAR_FILE:
00208       handle_src =  pentry_src->object.file.handle ;
00209       break ;
00210             
00211     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00212       handle_src =  pentry_src->object.symlink.handle ;
00213       break ;
00214       
00215     case DIR_BEGINNING:
00216       handle_src =  pentry_src->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00217       break ;
00218       
00219     case DIR_CONTINUE:
00220        /* lock the related dir_begin (dir begin are garbagge collected AFTER their related dir_cont)
00221        * this means that if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, its pdir pointer is not endless */
00222       P( pentry_src->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00223       handle_src =  pentry_src->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00224       V( pentry_src->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00225       break ;
00226       
00227     case CHARACTER_FILE:
00228     case BLOCK_FILE:
00229     case SOCKET_FILE:
00230     case FIFO_FILE:
00231       handle_src =  pentry_src->object.special_obj.handle ;
00232       break ;
00233 
00234     default:
00235        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT, "WARNING: unknown source pentry type: internal_md.type=%d, line %d in file %s", 
00236                          pentry_src->internal_md.type, __LINE__, __FILE__ ) ;
00237        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00238        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00239        return *pstatus ;
00240     }
00241 
00242   switch( pentry_dir_dest->internal_md.type )
00243     {
00244     case DIR_BEGINNING:
00245       handle_dest = pentry_dir_dest->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00246       break ;
00247 
00248       case DIR_CONTINUE:
00249        /* lock the related dir_begin (dir begin are garbagge collected AFTER their related dir_cont)
00250        * this means that if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, its pdir pointer is not endless */
00251       P( pentry_dir_dest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00252       handle_dest =  pentry_src->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00253       V( pentry_dir_dest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00254       break ;
00255     }
00256  
00257   /* If object is a data cached regular file, keeps it mtime and size, STEP 1 */
00258   if( ( pentry_src->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE )  &&  ( pentry_src->object.file.pentry_content != NULL ) )
00259    {
00260      save_mtime     = pentry_src->object.file.attributes.mtime ;
00261      save_size      = pentry_src->object.file.attributes.filesize ;
00262      save_spaceused = pentry_src->object.file.attributes.spaceused ;
00263    }
00264  
00265   /* Do the link at FSAL level */
00266   link_attributes.asked_attributes = pclient->attrmask;
00267   fsal_status = FSAL_link( &handle_src, &handle_dest, plink_name, pcontext, &link_attributes ) ;
00268   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00269     {
00270       *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ; 
00271       V(  pentry_dir_dest->lock ) ;
00272       V( pentry_src->lock ) ;
00273 
00274       if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00275         {
00276            cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00277            fsal_status_t        getattr_status ;
00278 
00279            DisplayLog( "cache_inode_link: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for at least one in  pentry = %p and pentry = %p", 
00280                         pentry_src, pentry_dir_dest ) ;
00281 
00282            /* Use FSAL_getattrs to find which entry is staled */
00283            getattr_status = FSAL_getattrs(  &handle_src, pcontext, &link_attributes ) ;
00284            if( getattr_status.major == ERR_FSAL_ACCESS )
00285             {
00286                DisplayLog( "cache_inode_link: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_src ) ;
00287 
00288                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_src, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00289                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_link: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_src, kill_status ) ;
00290             }           
00291 
00292            getattr_status = FSAL_getattrs(  &handle_dest, pcontext, &link_attributes ) ;
00293            if( getattr_status.major == ERR_FSAL_ACCESS )
00294             {
00295                DisplayLog( "cache_inode_link: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_dir_dest ) ;
00296 
00297                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_dir_dest, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00298                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_link: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_dir_dest, kill_status ) ;
00299             }           
00300 
00301         }
00302       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00303 
00304       return *pstatus ;
00305     }
00306  
00307   /* If object is a data cached regular file, keeps it mtime and size, STEP 2 */
00308   if( ( pentry_src->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE )  &&  ( pentry_src->object.file.pentry_content != NULL ) )
00309    {
00310      link_attributes.mtime     =  save_mtime     ; 
00311      link_attributes.filesize  =  save_size      ; 
00312      link_attributes.spaceused =  save_spaceused ;
00313    }
00314 
00315  
00316   /* Update cached attributes */
00317   switch( pentry_src->internal_md.type )
00318     {
00319     case REGULAR_FILE:
00320       pentry_src->object.file.attributes = link_attributes ;
00321       break ;
00322       
00323     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00324       pentry_src->object.symlink.attributes = link_attributes ;
00325       break ;
00326       
00327     case CHARACTER_FILE:
00328     case BLOCK_FILE:
00329     case SOCKET_FILE:
00330     case FIFO_FILE:
00331       pentry_src->object.special_obj.attributes = link_attributes ;
00332       break ;
00333       
00334       
00335     default:
00336       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT, "WARNING: Major type incoherency line %d in file %s", 
00337                          __LINE__, __FILE__ ) ;
00338       break ;
00339     }
00340   
00341   /* Add the new entry in the destination directory */
00342   if( cache_inode_add_cached_dirent( pentry_dir_dest, 
00343                                      plink_name, 
00344                                      pentry_src,
00345                                      NULL, 
00346                                      ht, 
00347                                      pclient, 
00348                                      pcontext,
00349                                      &status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00350     {
00351       V(  pentry_dir_dest->lock ) ;
00352       V( pentry_src->lock ) ;
00353       return *pstatus ;
00354     }
00355 
00356   /* Regular exit */
00357 
00358   /* return the attributes */
00359   *pattr = link_attributes ;
00360   
00361   /* Validate the entries */
00362   *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry_src, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00363   
00364   /* Release the target dir */
00365   V(  pentry_dir_dest->lock ) ;
00366 
00367   /* Release the source */
00368   V( pentry_src->lock ) ;
00369 
00370   /* stats */
00371   if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00372     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00373   else
00374     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_LINK] += 1 ;
00375 
00376   return *pstatus ; 
00377 }
Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:52 2008 for Cache inode layer by  1.3.9.1
